trigger_event: As city districts polarize along the values revealed by the Shadow Ballot, the Council seeks to regain control. State media receives confidential orders: shape public sentiment in favor of unity, or risk losing broadcast rights altogether. Meanwhile, dissidents urge amplification of the spontaneous Memory Markets movement, promising exclusive access if Rada will defy the Council line.
dilemma: Rada must decide whether to use her influence to champion the Council’s carefully managed 'Peace Exchange' campaign to foster enforced unity, or instead defy orders and legitimize the grassroots Memory Markets that challenge the system’s control of history.
reason: Rada is torn between using her platform as a State Media Correspondent to maintain fragile peace (as the Council demands) and her passion as a rogue journalist to expose hidden truths—even if it risks greater chaos. Her conversations with Alex, the bartender who encourages her to follow her instincts, further complicate her choice.
choice_a: Broadcast and promote the Council’s Peace Exchange, encouraging districts to swap chosen civic values for two weeks in hopes of building empathy and stability.
belief_a: Temporary unity can prevent open conflict.
Experiencing the other side’s reality might bring long-term understanding.
Careful messaging from the press can keep unrest from escalating.
choice_b: Spotlight and inspire the Memory Markets, using forbidden analog methods to give voice to erased stories and encourage more citizens to participate despite Council threats.
belief_b: The only lasting unity is built on honest memory, not forced unity.
People need spaces free from surveillance to heal old wounds.
Journalists should reveal truth, even if it threatens the order.
